titles.en: The Book of Tawheed (Oneness of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>)

titles.ar: باب آخَرُ وَ هُوَ مِنَ الْبَابِ الْأَوَّلِ
titles.en: Chapter 13 – Another (chapter), and it is from the first chapter

titles.ar: بَابُ النَّهْيِ عَنِ الْجِسْمِ وَ الصُّورَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 11 – The Forbiddance from (describing Allah<sup>azwj</sup>) with the body and the image
The Book of Tawheed (Oneness of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (9/ 2)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ الطَّيَالِسِيِّ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ لَمْ يَزَلِ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ رَبَّنَا وَ الْعِلْمُ ذَاتُهُ وَ لَا مَعْلُومَ وَ السَّمْعُ ذَاتُهُ وَ لَا مَسْمُوعَ وَ الْبَصَرُ ذَاتُهُ وَ لَا مُبْصَرَ وَ الْقُدْرَةُ ذَاتُهُ وَ لَا مَقْدُورَ
فَلَمَّا أَحْدَثَ الْأَشْيَاءَ وَ كَانَ الْمَعْلُومُ وَقَعَ الْعِلْمُ مِنْهُ عَلَى الْمَعْلُومِ وَ السَّمْعُ عَلَى الْمَسْمُوعِ وَ الْبَصَرُ عَلَى الْمُبْصَرِ وَ الْقُدْرَةُ عَلَى الْمَقْدُورِ

قَالَ قُلْتُ فَلَمْ يَزَلِ اللَّهُ مُتَحَرِّكاً قَالَ فَقَالَ تَعَالَى اللَّهُ عَنْ ذَلِكَ إِنَّ الْحَرَكَةَ صِفَةٌ مُحْدَثَةٌ بِالْفِعْلِ قَالَ قُلْتُ فَلَمْ يَزَلِ اللَّهُ مُتَكَلِّماً قَالَ فَقَالَ إِنَّ الْكَلَامَ صِفَةٌ مُحْدَثَةٌ لَيْسَتْ بِأَزَلِيَّةٍ كَانَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ لَا مُتَكَلِّمَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Khalid Al Tayalisy, from Safwan Bin Yahya, from Ibn Muskan, from Abu Baseer who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic never ceased to be our Lord<sup>azwj</sup>; and the Knowledge is His<sup>azwj</sup> Self and (even though) there may be nothing to be known, and the Hearing is His<sup>azwj</sup> Self and (even though) there may be nothing to be heard, and the Seeing is His<sup>azwj</sup> Self and (even though) there may be nothing to be seen, and the Power is His<sup>azwj</sup> Self and (even though) there may be nothing to be empowered upon.

So when He<sup>azwj</sup> Created the things, and it was the known (things), the Knowledge Occurred from Him<sup>azwj</sup> upon the known, and the Hearing upon the heard, and the Seeing upon the seen, and the Power upon the empowered’.

He (the narrator) said, ‘I said, ‘So Allah<sup>azwj</sup> does not cease to be moving’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> is more Exalted from that. The movement is a quality created by the deed’. I said, ‘So Allah<sup>azwj</sup> did not cease to be Speaking’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The speech is a created quality, it is not with the eternality. Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic was, and He<sup>azwj</sup> did not Speak’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn Khalid al-Tayalisi from Safwan ibn Yahya from ibn Maskan from abu Basir who has said the following. “I heard abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) saying, ‘The Exalted, the Glorious, Allah, our Lord, is Eternal. Knowledge is His self even if there is nothing to be known. Hearing is His self even if there is nothing to be heard. Seeing is His-self even when there is nothing to be seen. Power is His self even if there is nothing to feel the power. When He brought things into existence the perceptible objects became the objects of His knowledge, His hearing applied to audible objects, His seeing to visible objects and His power to the objects that feel power.’” Abu Basir adds; “I further asked, ‘Has Allah always been in motion?” He replied, “Allah is High Exalted above that. Motion is an attribute that is created through action.” I asked, “Did Allah always have the ability to speak?” He replied, “ Speech is a created attribute and not an eternal one. Allah, the Majestic, the Glorious, existed when there was nothing able to speak.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/10)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ كَانَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ لَا شَيْ‏ءَ غَيْرُهُ وَ لَمْ يَزَلْ عَالِماً بِمَا يَكُونُ فَعِلْمُهُ بِهِ قَبْلَ كَوْنِهِ كَعِلْمِهِ بِهِ بَعْدَ كَوْنِهِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Salim, from Muhammad Bin Muslim,

Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I heard him<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic was and there was nothing else apart from Him<sup>azwj</sup>, and He<sup>azwj</sup> has not ceased to be Knowing with what is going to occur, and He<sup>azwj</sup> Knew of it before its occurrence, just like His<sup>azwj</sup> Knowledge of it after its occurrence’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hisham ibn Salim from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following. “I heard abu Ja‘far (a.s.) saying, ‘Allah, to Whom belong Might and Majesty, existed when nothing else existed. He eternally knows whatever comes into being. His knowledge of things before their coming into existence and afterwards is exactly the same.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/10)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنِ الْكَاهِلِيِّ قَالَ

text: كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي دُعَاءٍ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ مُنْتَهَى عِلْمِهِ فَكَتَبَ إِلَيَّ لَا تَقُولَنَّ مُنْتَهَى عِلْمِهِ فَلَيْسَ لِعِلْمِهِ مُنْتَهًى وَ لَكِنْ قُلْ مُنْتَهَى رِضَاهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Safwan Bin Yahya, from Al Kahily who said,

‘I wrote to Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> regarding the supplication ‘The Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> the end-point of His<sup>azwj</sup> Knowledge’ (دُعَاءٍ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ مُنْتَهَى عِلْمِهِ). So he<sup>asws</sup> wrote back: ‘Do not be saying, ‘End-point of His<sup>azwj</sup> Knowledge’, for there is no end-point to His<sup>azwj</sup> Knowledge. But, say, ‘End-point of His<sup>azwj</sup> Pleasure (for His<sup>azwj</sup> creatures)’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Safwan ibn Yahya from al-Kahili who has said the following. “I wrote to abu al-Hassan (al-Kazim) (a.s.), praising Allah in my letter as, ‘All praise belongs to Allah to the limit of His knowledge.’” He wrote back to me, “Do not say, “To the limit of His knowledge because there is no limit to His knowledge. Instead say, “All praise belongs to Allah to the limit of His pleasure.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/11)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ أَيُّوبَ بْنِ نُوحٍ أَنَّ

text: هُ كَتَبَ إِلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَسْأَلُهُ عَنِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَ كَانَ يَعْلَمُ الْأَشْيَاءَ قَبْلَ أَنْ خَلَقَ الْأَشْيَاءَ وَ كَوَّنَهَا أَوْ لَمْ يَعْلَمْ ذَلِكَ حَتَّى خَلَقَهَا وَ أَرَادَ خَلْقَهَا وَ تَكْوِينَهَا فَعَلِمَ مَا خَلَقَ عِنْدَ مَا خَلَقَ وَ مَا كَوَّنَ عِنْدَ مَا كَوَّنَ
فَوَقَّعَ بِخَطِّهِ لَمْ يَزَلِ اللَّهُ عَالِماً بِالْأَشْيَاءِ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْلُقَ الْأَشْيَاءَ كَعِلْمِهِ بِالْأَشْيَاءِ بَعْدَ مَا خَلَقَ الْأَشْيَاءَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Sa’ad Bin Abdullah, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ayoub Bin Nuh,

‘He wrote to Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> asking him<sup>asws</sup> about Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic, ‘Did He<sup>azwj</sup> Know of the things before He<sup>azwj</sup> Created the things and their occurrence (coming into being), or did He<sup>azwj</sup> not Know that until He<sup>azwj</sup> Created these and Intended their Creation and their coming into being, So He<sup>azwj</sup> Knew what He<sup>azwj</sup> Created during what He<sup>azwj</sup> Created, and what is to come into being during what came into being’.

So he<sup>asws</sup> signed: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> never ceased to be Knowing of the thing before He<sup>azwj</sup> Created the things, just like His<sup>azwj</sup> Knowledge of the things after having Created the things’.
en.sarwar: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Sa‘d ibn ‘Abdallah from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Ayyub ibn Nuh, who wrote to abu al-Hassan (al-Thalith (a.s.) asking him about Allah, the Majestic, the Glorious. “Did He know all things before creating and giving them being, or did He not know until He brought them into existence or until He willed their creation and existence? Did Allah come to know what He created during the process of their creation and what He originated during their being originated?” The Imam wrote in reply in his own handwriting, “Eternally Allah has had full knowledge of all things, before as well as after their creation.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (11/ 2)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَمْزَةَ قَالَ

text: كَتَبْتُ إِلَى الرَّجُلِ ( عليه السلام ) أَسْأَلُهُ أَنَّ مَوَالِيَكَ اخْتَلَفُوا فِي الْعِلْمِ فَقَالَ بَعْضُهُمْ لَمْ يَزَلِ اللَّهُ عَالِماً قَبْلَ فِعْلِ الْأَشْيَاءِ وَ قَالَ بَعْضُهُمْ لَا نَقُولُ لَمْ يَزَلِ اللَّهُ عَالِماً لِأَنَّ مَعْنَى يَعْلَمُ يَفْعَلُ فَإِنْ أَثْبَتْنَا الْعِلْمَ فَقَدْ أَثْبَتْنَا فِي الْأَزَلِ مَعَهُ شَيْئاً فَإِنْ رَأَيْتَ جَعَلَنِيَ اللَّهُ فِدَاكَ أَنْ تُعَلِّمَنِي مِنْ ذَلِكَ مَا أَقِفُ عَلَيْهِ وَ لَا أَجُوزُهُ
فَكَتَبَ ( عليه السلام ) بِخَطِّهِ لَمْ يَزَلِ اللَّهُ عَالِماً تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى ذِكْرُهُ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ja’far Bin Muhammad Bin Hamza who said,

‘I wrote to the man<sup>asws</sup> asking him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The ones in your<sup>asws</sup> Wilayah are differing regarding the Knowledge. So, some of them say, ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> did not cease to be a Knower before He<sup>azwj</sup> Doing (Creating) the things’; and some of them say, ‘We are not saying that He<sup>azwj</sup> did not cease to be a Knower because the meaning of the knowledge is by a deed. So if we prove the Knowledge (as being eternal), so we have proved in the eternality, the things along with it’. So what is your<sup>asws</sup> view, may I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>, if you<sup>asws</sup> could teach me from that what I could pause upon and not exceed it’.
So he<sup>asws</sup> wrote in his<sup>asws</sup> own handwriting: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> did not cease to be a Knower. Blessed and High is His<sup>azwj</sup> Mention’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ja‘far ibn Muhammad ibn Hamzah who has said the following. “I wrote to the man (Imam (a.s.), ‘Your followers differ about the knowledge of Allah. There are those who say that before creating all things Allah had eternally full knowledge of them. Others say that we should not say so because His knowing is like His action. If we prove that His Knowledge is eternal we have also established another thing eternal along with Him. May Allah take my soul in service for your cause, if you would consider it proper, kindly enlighten me in this issue so that I would have a firm stand and do not waver therefrom.” He wrote in his own handwriting, “Eternally Allah , the Most Holy, the Most High has had the Knowledge of all things.” ?? and Allah’s Positive Attributes such as His knowledge are the same as His Essence without any duality between His Essence and His Positive Attributes).’ “

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/12)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الصَّمَدِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ فُضَيْلِ بْنِ سُكَّرَةَ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِنْ رَأَيْتَ أَنْ تُعَلِّمَنِي هَلْ كَانَ اللَّهُ جَلَّ وَجْهُهُ يَعْلَمُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْلُقَ الْخَلْقَ أَنَّهُ وَحْدَهُ فَقَدِ اخْتَلَفَ مَوَالِيكَ فَقَالَ بَعْضُهُمْ قَدْ كَانَ يَعْلَمُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْلُقَ شَيْئاً مِنْ خَلْقِهِ وَ قَالَ بَعْضُهُمْ إِنَّمَا مَعْنَى يَعْلَمُ يَفْعَلُ فَهُوَ الْيَوْمَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّهُ لَا غَيْرُهُ قَبْلَ فِعْلِ الْأَشْيَاءِ فَقَالُوا إِنْ أَثْبَتْنَا أَنَّهُ لَمْ يَزَلْ عَالِماً بِأَنَّهُ لَا غَيْرُهُ فَقَدْ أَثْبَتْنَا مَعَهُ غَيْرَهُ فِي أَزَلِيَّتِهِ
فَإِنْ رَأَيْتَ يَا سَيِّدِي أَنْ تُعَلِّمَنِي مَا لَا أَعْدُوهُ إِلَى غَيْرِهِ فَكَتَبَ ( عليه السلام ) مَا زَالَ اللَّهُ عَالِماً تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى ذِكْرُهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Husayn Bin Saeed, from Al Qasim Bin Muhammad, from Abdul Samad Bin Bashir, from Fuzayl Bin sukkara who said,

‘I said to Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! If you<sup>asws</sup> see fit, if you<sup>asws</sup> could teach me, ‘Did Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, Majestic is His<sup>azwj</sup> Face, Know before He<sup>azwj</sup> Created the creation that He<sup>azwj</sup> is One, for the ones in your<sup>asws</sup> Wilayah are differing. So, some of them say, He<sup>azwj</sup> was Knowing before He<sup>azwj</sup> Creating a thing from His<sup>azwj</sup> creation’, and some of them say, ‘But rather, the meaning of knowing is His<sup>azwj</sup> Doing, thus today He<sup>azwj</sup> Knows that He<sup>azwj</sup> (is One), there being no other, before He Did (Create) the things. So they are saying, ‘It is proved for us that He<sup>azwj</sup> did not cease to be a Knower that He<sup>azwj</sup> (is One), there is none other, and so it is proved for us that there was other than Him<sup>azwj</sup> (i.e., Knowledge), along with Him<sup>azwj</sup> in His<sup>azwj</sup> eternality’.

So if you<sup>asws</sup> see fit, O my Chief<sup>asws</sup>, if you<sup>asws</sup> could teach me what I do not leave it to something else’. So he<sup>asws</sup> wrote: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> did not cease to be a Knower. Blessed and High is His<sup>azwj</sup> Mention’.
en.sarwar: 6. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from al-Qasim ibn Muhammad from ’Abd al-Samad ibn Bashir from Fudayl ibn Sukkarah who has said the following. “I asked abu Ja‘far (a.s.), ‘May Allah take my soul in service for your cause, if you would consider it proper please enlighten me about whether Allah, Majestic is Whose face, had knowledge of His Oneness before He brought the creation into existence? Your followers differ on this issue. There are those who believe that Allah did have knowledge of His Oneness before He created anything. Others say His knowledge is His action. Thus, now Allah has come to know that before He created things there had been nothing besides He Himself. They say that if we believe in the eternal knowledge of Allah of His Oneness, we have established another thing eternal along with Him. If you would consider it proper please enlighten me in this issue so I may not waver here and there.” He wrote, “Allah, the Blessed and Exalted has always had the Knowledge of all things.” (See Hadith No. 294 – 53)
